far_heaa.high_throughput package

Submodules

far_heaa.high_throughput.equi_miscT_predictions module

class far_heaa.high_throughput.equi_miscT_predictions.EquiMiscTPredictions(dim: int, element_list: List[str], lattice: str, meta_data: Dict)

Bases: object

A class to predict miscible temperatures (Misc_T) and average melting temperatures (Avg_Tm) for multinary alloys based on a thermodynamic model.

Parameters:

  • dim (int) – The dimensionality of the system (e.g., number of elements in the alloys).

  • element_list (List[str]) – A list of elements (strings) representing the alloys in the system.

  • lattice (str) – The lattice type (e.g., “FCC”, “BCC”).

  • meta_data (Dict) – A dictionary containing metadata required for the calculations, including flags, file paths, and API keys.

lattice

The lattice type.

Type:

str

mol_grid_size

The size of the mol grid.

Type:

int

tm

An instance of the ThermoMaths class for thermodynamic calculations.

Type:

ThermoMaths

grid_iterator

An iterator for navigating the thermodynamic grid.

Type:

GridIterator

compositions

A list of alloy compositions generated from the element list.

Type:

List[str]

make_predictions() → DataFrame

Predict the miscible temperatures (Misc_T) and average melting temperatures (Avg_Tm) for the multinary alloys.

Returns:

A DataFrame containing alloys, miscible temperatures, and average melting temperatures.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Example

predictions_df = EquiMiscTPredictions.make_predictions() # predictions_df will contain the miscible and average melting temperatures for the alloys.

plot_predictions(Tm_constraint: float | None = None, alloy_constraint: str | None = None) → None

Plot the miscible temperatures (Misc_T) and average melting temperatures (Avg_Tm) for the alloys based on the predictions.

Parameters:

  • Tm_constraint (float, optional) – A constraint on the maximum allowed temperature relative to Avg_Tm.

  • alloy_constraint (str, optional) – A constraint to filter the alloys by a specific string.

Example

EquiMiscTPredictions.plot_predictions(Tm_constraint=0.8, alloy_constraint=’Fe’) # This will plot the temperatures for alloys containing ‘Fe’ with misc_T < 0.8*Tm.
